'Clemson University' The pronunciation of Clemson varies. The consonant
written â¨sâ© may be either or , in which case many insert a between the two
syllables. Because of the pinâpen merger, many locals use as the first
vowel. is an American public, coeducational, land-grant and sea-grant
research university located in Clemson, South Carolina, United States.

Founded in 1889, Clemson University consists of five colleges: Agriculture,
Forestry and Life Sciences; Architecture, Arts and Humanities; Business and
Behavioral Sciences; Engineering and Science; and Health, Education and Human
Development. As of the year 2012, Clemson
University enrolled a total of 16,562 undergraduate students for the fall
semester and 4,206 graduate students and the
student/faculty ratio is 16:1. The cost of in-state
tuition is about $11,078 and out-of-state tuition is $25,388.
